driving to swallow carp bile to treat the disease.
However, a woman had to be hospitalized.  The
emergency room incident in Dak Lak province is a
warning to those who like to treat
diseases with unproven tricks.
According to the Central Highlands General Hospital, the
patient is 39-year-old Ms. T, residing
in E Cao Commune, City B.
Because she had a history of colon
and stomach diseases, she heard that carp fish can
help cure diseases and improve health, so she
took carp bile, dipped it in
boiling water and then swallowed it.
However, after that, the patient showed signs of
nausea and swelling of the face and limbs, so his
family took him to the emergency room at the hospital. The doctor
diagnosed the patient with acute kidney injury. He has been
monitoring treatment for carp bile poisoning
until now.  The patient is
progressing well according to the doctor. Carp bile has
toxins that are harmful to the human body. When swallowing fish bile, the
toxins in the bile will cause
damage mainly to the kidneys. If not
treated promptly, the patient can die.  A
